snippet: The Period of the Long Change refers to the second period of hockey games, when teams defend the end of the ice farther from their benches. The N.H.L. is considering adopting that setup for overtime.
abstract: Slap Shot column examines Period of the Long Change, second period in professional hockey games when teams defend the end of the ice farther from their benches, resulting in a higher rate of goals; notes that NHL managers are considering whether to adopt format for overtime in order to reduce number of games decided by shootout; other hockey items noted.
lead_paragraph: The Period of the Long Change refers to the second period of hockey games, when teams defend the end of the ice farther from their benches. The N.H.L. is considering adopting that setup for overtime.

headline.main: Disdaining Shootouts, General Managers Push an Overtime Turnabout
headline.print_headline: Disdaining Shootouts, General Managers Will Try an Overtime Turnabout
